result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew H Balcsik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).
  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: fined $100 plus costs including DNA surcharge, 120 dtp or com warrant,  pay at Clerk of Courts
no firearms, firearms need to be turned in
counseling to include some type of grief counseling, evaluation and follow through
No contact with victims or residences or any place they are occupying
Submit a DNA sample (if not done previously)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew H Balcsik

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew H Balcsik in court.  Jennifer Anne Bork appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    

Defendant - does not qualify for Public Defender, can't afford an attorney, did not apply for Court appointed  
Court questions Defendant, won't qualify for appointed  
State - made offer, Defendant did not accept, plea to all counts, Cts 1 & 4 - 2 yrs Prob, Cts 2 & 3 - 30 days jail with no contact with victims and court costs  
Defendant makes statement   
Court rvws options, right to trial    
Defendant does not wish trial, wants to plead and argue sentencing   
Court accepts waiver of counsel, rvws plea questionnaire on the record  
Defendant pleads guilty, own words/factual basis    
State - complied with victim's rights, victims wish to make statement  
Court finds factual basis exists, plea knowingly and voluntarily, understand rights, finds Defendant guilty, JOC entered    
Victims make statement, would like to see Defendant get counseling, rqst no contact, rqst 120 days  
State - no prior criminal history, makes statement re: threats from Defendant, jail time is appropriate, Cts 1 & 4 - 2 yrs Prob ea ct conc, Cts 2 & 3 - 30 days jail each ct consec, no contact w/victims or their residence, DNA sample and surcharge, court costs        
Defendant makes statement - jail time is ridiculous, doesn't need counseling, thinks sentence should be Probation, knows he messed up, he's here, what he did was very wrong, may have problems getting to work from jail         
Court - low level misdemeanors, no prior record, consider need to protect public, seriousness of offense, character of offender   
Sentence:  S W/H 2 yrs Prob ea ct conc with conditions: counseling to include some type of grief counseling +, no contact with victims or residences or any place they are occupying, no firearms, firearms need to be turned in, DNA sample and surcharge, $100 fine +c + s, 120 dtp

Defendant Andrew H Balcsik in court.  Jennifer Anne Bork appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 03:10 pm.
